byline.original: By N. R. KLEINFIELD and JOHN ELIGON
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, Joseph Goldstein, Colin Moynihan and William K. Rashbaum.

abstract: Hundreds of off-duty New York City police officers converge on Bronx courthouse as indictments are unsealed following a three-year investigation into pattern of ticket-fixing at the NYPD; officers unleash a stunning display of vitriol, applauding their accused colleagues and denouncing their prosecution.
snippet: The stunning display of vitriol at a Bronx courthouse by hundreds of off-duty officers raised concerns about the mind-set of the force.
lead_paragraph: The stunning display of vitriol at a Bronx courthouse by hundreds of off-duty officers raised concerns about the mind-set of the force.

headline.main: Officers Jeer at Arraignment of 16 Colleagues in Ticket-Fixing Investigation
headline.print_headline: Officers Unleash Vitriol as Peers Are Charged in Ticket-Fixing
headline.seo: Officers Unleash Anger at Ticket-Fixing Arraignments in the Bronx
